item.title: Nvidia Partner Hon Hai Meets Sales Estimates on Strong AI Demand
item.description: Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. reported 15.8% growth in quarterly sales on robust demand for AI servers and iPhones.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: The Foxconn Technology Co. booth at the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Wednesday, May 21, 2025. Computex kicked off Monday in Taipei, and as in years past drew industry chieftains from Nvidia Corp.'s Jensen Huang and Qualcomm Inc.'s Cristiano Amon to Young Liu of Foxconn, which makes the bulk of the world's iPhones and Nvidia servers. Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg

item.title: US Plans AI Chip Curbs on Malaysia, Thailand Over China Concerns
item.description: President Donald Trump’s administration plans to restrict shipments of AI chips from the likes of Nvidia Corp. to Malaysia and Thailand, part of an effort to crack down on suspected semiconductor smuggling into China.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins

item.title: Harvard Warns Foreign Students Over US Airport, Social Media
item.description: Harvard University staff advised international students to be cautious about social media posts and warned some groups against arriving at Boston’s Logan International Airport.
item.dc:creator: Anika Arora Seth, Emma Haidar, Brunella Tipismana Urbano

media:content.media:description: The Harvard University campus in Cambridge, Massachusetts, US, on Wednesday, June 4, 2025. Harvard University won a longer-term reprieve from a Trump administration ban on enrolling international students, handing the nations oldest and richest university a victory in its battle with the White House.

item.title: Google to Propose Price-Comparison Box in Search to Appease EU
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google will propose highlighting search results from other companies’ shopping and travel platforms at the top of its page in an attempt to comply with the European Union’s Digital Markets Act and fend off fines, people familiar the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Gian Volpicelli

item.title: Hip-Hop Musical Subverts Silicon Valley Founder Stereotypes
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet reports on a musical that puts a new spin on the myth of the Silicon Valley startup founder.
item.dc:creator: Ellen Huet

media:content.media:description: The Co-Founders musical examines Silicon Valley’s narratives around entrepreneurship.

item.title: Louis Vuitton Korea Suffers Cyberattack as Customer Data Leaked
item.description: Louis Vuitton Korea suffered a cyberattack that compromised some customer data, the second time in recent months that hackers have targeted the world’s largest luxury group.
item.dc:creator: Jaehyun Eom

item.title: SK Telecom Waives Cancellation Fees After Major Data Breach
item.description: SK Telecom Co. is waiving cancellation fees for customers who want to leave its network after South Korean authorities said the carrier should scrap the penalties following a major data breach.
item.dc:creator: Yoolim Lee

media:content.media:description: SK Telecom Co. headquarters in Seoul. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: China’s Main Grid Sees Renewables Trimming Chance of Blackouts
item.description: China’s record buildout of renewables may help networks overcome weather-driven demand spikes, according to the research arm of the country’s biggest grid operator.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Kathy Chen

media:content.media:description: The Dunhuang Photovoltaic Industrial Park in Dunhuang, Gansu Province, China.

item.title: British Library CEO: ‘Every Generation Has a Phase of Panic’
item.description: Rebecca Lawrence is more focused on securing new funding and dealing with the aftermath of a cyberattack than stressing about literacy and AI.
item.dc:creator: Mishal Husain

item.title: US Says GE Aerospace Can Restart Jet Engine Exports to China
item.description: The US has lifted its export ban on American-made jet engine parts and technology to China, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Kiel Porter, Danny Lee

media:content.media:description: An attendee checks his mobile phone while standing near a GEnx jet engine, manufactured by General Electric Co., on the opening day of the Farnborough International Airshow (FIA) 2018 in Farnborough, U.K., on Monday, July 16, 2018. The air show, a biannual showcase for the aviation industry, runs until July 22. Photographer: Mary Turner/Bloomberg

item.title: ChatGPT’s Mental Health Costs Are Adding Up
item.description: From brain rot to induced psychosis, the psychological cost of generative AI is growing and flying under the radar.
item.dc:creator: Parmy Olson

media:content.media:description: A laptop keyboard and ChatGPT on App Store displayed on a phone screen are seen in this illustration photo taken in Poland on October 8, 2024. (Photo by Jakub Porzycki/NurPhoto via Getty Images)

item.title: Uniqlo Owner, Seven & i To Set Tone for Japan’s Consumer Sector
item.description: Uniqlo owner Fast Retailing Co. and Seven & i Holdings Co. will show how Japan’s consumer sector is faring as Asia’s earnings season kicks off.
item.dc:creator: Reina Sasaki, Justina T Lee, Harshita Swaminathan

media:content.media:description: Uniqlo Park in Mitsui Outlet Park Yokohama Bayside in Yokohama. Photographer: Noriko Hayashi/Bloomberg

item.title: Top Asian Fund Bets Samsung Breakthrough to Extend Kospi Gains
item.description: A peer-beating Asian equity fund is turning its sights on Samsung Electronics Co. amid a rally in Korean equities.
item.dc:creator: Sangmi Cha

item.title: 'Superintelligence' Is Silicon Valley’s New Favorite AI Buzzword
item.description: A new AI buzzword is picking up speed in Silicon Valley.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive officer of Meta Platforms Inc., during an interview on "The Circuit with Emily Chang" at Meta headquarters in Menlo Park, California, US, on Thursday, July 18, 2024. Facebook parent company Meta Platforms Inc. debuted a new and powerful AI model, called Llama 3.1, that Zuckerberg called "state of the art" and said will rival similar offerings from competitors.

item.title: Meta Adds Startup Founder Gross to New AI Superintelligence Lab
item.description: Daniel Gross, the former chief executive officer and co-founder of artificial intelligence startup Safe Superintelligence Inc., is joining Meta Platforms Inc.’s new superintelligence lab focused on AI.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary, Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: Meta headquarters in Menlo Park, California, US, on Tuesday, Jan 28, 2025. Meta Platforms Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on January 29. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Xbox Executives Were Blown Away by an Upcoming Game. Then They Canceled It.
item.description: Blackbird, a new game from ZeniMax Online Studios, impressed Xbox boss Phil Spencer earlier this year
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: The Elder Scrolls Online, released in 2014, has become one of the most lucrative games in Microsoft’s portfolio Photographer: Zenimax Online Studios

item.title: OpenAI, Oracle Expand Stargate Project | Bloomberg Tech 7/3/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow discuss OpenAI's deal with Oracle as they search for more compute capacity. Plus, a look at President Donald Trump's tax and spending bill as it nears a successful House vote. And the White House lifts some chip design software curbs on China. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Dr. Phil’s Media Firm Fired Most Employees, Ended Production When It Filed Bankruptcy
item.description: Merit Street Media, the television startup founded by celebrity psychologist Phil McGraw, laid off all but six of its employees the day it filed bankruptcy, saying it can’t make any new content after being forced out of business by its broadcasting partner.
item.dc:creator: Steven Church

item.title: Russian Billionaire Fights VC in Court Over Troubled Partnership
item.description: When Russian billionaire Dmitry Rybolovlev met Seth Harrison 15 years ago, he was looking to invest some of his fortune in the life sciences sector, and the seasoned American venture capitalist seemed like the right partner.
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Willmer

media:content.media:description: Dmitry Rybolovlev arrives at court in New York in 2024 in another case.

item.title: Latin American VC Activity Slows to Near Pre-Pandemic Lows
item.description: Venture capital dealmaking in Latin America has hit the slowest pace in almost seven years, in part due to global economic uncertainty and a pullback from US investors in the region.
item.dc:creator: Maria Clara Cobo
